title: Max. Ca2+ to keep F- level for dental health -calc

content.description: <math alttext="C a F 2, solid, is in equilibrium with C a with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 F with a negative 1 charge, aqueous; K sub s p, equals 1.5 times 10 to the negative 11" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>Ca</mtext> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>⇄</mo> </mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>Ca</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mtext> F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"> </mspace> </mrow> </mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>s</mi> <mi>p</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>11</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
content.question: The concentration of <math alttext="F with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in drinking water that is considered to be ideal for promoting dental health is <math alttext="4.0 times 10 the negative 5 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the information above, the maximum concentration of <math alttext="C a with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ca</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> that can be present in drinking water without lowering the concentration of <math alttext="F with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> below the ideal level is closest to

<math alttext="0.0094 molar" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>0.0094</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mi>M</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
